quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I, uh... I am going to be a father.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Angelina Jolie was on. And she adopted a baby from Asia, and she said that it changed her life. And that really inspired me. So, I want you to look into seeing how much a little Chinese baby would cost.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Maybe you should wait before you adopt.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Roy's sister looked into it, and the application alone costs a thousand dollars.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Um... find out if there's a cheaper, less expensive baby out there, okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You know, she also said the waiting list is like eight months.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't even know if I'll want a baby in eight months.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know what, Pam? If in ten years, I haven't had a baby, and you haven't had a baby...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: All right. Three pairs of pants. Three pairs of socks. Three packs of condoms.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Guess where I am going. I will give you a hint. It is a booze-fueled sex romp, where anything goes. You are correct, sir! I am headed to Philadelphia for the Annual Northeastern Mid-Market Office Supply Convention. And Jim Halpert is going to be coming, which will be fun. Poor little guy. He's been stuck working under Josh, the poor man's Michael Scott, as he is known around my condo.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Don't be mad, it is a business trip.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: But I don't understand. It's for managers.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Monkey, I am an A. R. M., Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I know! It... I was just really hoping we could spend some time together. [A long silence.] Are you still there?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Don't "Monkey" me! You can't wait to get out of here, A. R. M.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: In the Martin family, we like to say, "Looks like someone took the slow train from Philly." That's code for "check out the slut." What is... why are there flies in here?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Oh my God! Are you so excited for tonight? I am so excited. You guys are going to click, I can feel it. So what are you wearing?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes, I have a date. He's a cartoonist for the local paper, which is really neat, because I like to draw too. I'm kind of nervous. I haven't been on a first date in nine years... probably shouldn't broadcast that.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Well, remember, no matter how much you may want to, do not sleep with him on the first date. It gives him all the power.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sleep with who? Whom, whom... whom?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: My neighbor Alan. They're going on a date tonight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, wow! Oh my God, I have a great idea. You know what you should do to be hilarious? Wear your wedding dress. It would be a great icebreaker.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Really? Okay. Well, word of advice: unbutton that top button. Let those things breathe. Any message you want me to relate to Jim?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: There's my girl. I noticed you handing out some shekels. How would one get on that train?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: That was for per diem, for Philadelphia.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: That town smells like cheese steaks.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: That town is full of history!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Andrea's the office bitch. You'll get used to her. [introducing himself] Creed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Can I have my neck pillow back? Michael! Can I have my neck pillow back?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Good to see you. There he is! There's the traitor! Traitor! Traitor! Come here, you. Come here! Yeah! The product... the progidal... my son returns.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I was shocked when he told me he was transferring to Stamford. It's like the firemen. You don't leave your brothers behind, even if you find out that there is a better fire in Connecticut.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It's really good to see you, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah! Wow, I didn't expect that. It's good to see you too!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, hey, how's it going up there? Have you made any sales yet?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, it's not. I did. Yep.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know, when I saw Dwight, I realized how stupid and petty all those pranks I pulled on him were. And then he spoke. I wonder how hard it would be to get a copy of his room key.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Pam's back on the market again.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: If I weren't engaged, I would so hit that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So what kind of commissions you get up there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, Dwight. I've missed you so much.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: Listen, Michael, I heard you were a great salesman.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: And I just want to let you know that if our branch absorbs your branch, I'm going to look for a place for you at Stamford.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Great, let's dump our stuff and meet back here in half an hour.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jan? Look, I think we need to set some ground rules.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: The eight-hundred pound gorilla in the room. Carol. I'm still dating her, so nothing can happen between us at the convention.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you for being so brave with all of this. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Alan's cartoon is so funny, right?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: And they're, like, so smart. I don't even know what they mean half the time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This party is going to be awesome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know! That is specifically why I chose a room close to the elevator. More foot traffic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That is crooked on that side.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That is a lot of liquor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, that's how we do it in Scranton. Or did you forget? There ain't no party like a Scranton party, 'cause a Scranton party don't stop.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: We should probably head on down and hook up with Jan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, well, we have time! One for the road, gentlemen?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, no, sorry, it's an inside joke. There's this bartender at Stamford who, uh... you know what? You'd just have to be there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wish I was. I love inside jokes. I'd love to be a part of one someday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right, see you guys down there. Change your mind, come back up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ugh, that would be gross. It's not even lunch yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: SWAG! Stuff we all get. I basically decorated my condo for free with all of my SWAG.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Check it out. Hi, I'm Michael Scott, Dunder-Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Dwight Schrute, Assistant Regional Manager, Dunder-Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know what? I'm having a huge blowout tonight, Room 308. Hope you can come.

quotes.speaker: Jerome Bettis
quotes.line: All right, maybe. If I can.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, cool! Okay, so... can I tell people you're gonna be there?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Why do they call him The Bus?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do you remember me from last year? There's a party in my room, 308, can't miss it, right off the elevator. Tonight. Be there!

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: All right, Jan just emailed me. She wants us to meet her up front.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You don't have email on your phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't have to, I just know. Yes, hello?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right, nice meeting you, Ted. Take care.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [into phone] See you in a bit. Bye-bye. [to Dwight] May I have a moment of your time please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I need you to do something for me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I want you to dig up some dirt on Josh. Find out if there are any skeletons in his attic.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'll talk to my buddy down at the station, stat.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: It's, uh... I was... might ask if you wanted...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [answering phone] Dunder-Mifflin, this is Pam. He's not in the office. Can I take a message? I will. You too. [hangs up] Sorry. What's up?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Um, if, uh... um... I just completely forgot what I was going to say. It's so weird.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay. Well, if you think of it, I'll be here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So I called my buddy down at the station today. Had them run a background check on Josh Porter. See if there's any known aliases, et cetera.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Business has been pretty crazy around the office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. Moved Ryan over to your desk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, tell him I say hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I will call him later with that message.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Toby Flenderson is everything that is wrong with the paper industry. Is he why you left?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, no, it was... you know, a good opportunity for me, a promotion. I got a chance to...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Opportunity, promotion, blah, blah. You know, Jim, those are just words. Have you taken into account other factors, vis-a-vis bosses? Is Josh funnier than I am? Does he even have a girlfriend? Because I have two, basically.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Michael, it's really not a competition.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: Jim got us a great lead with a new rep from National Envelope. We can grab lunch with them tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, Jan, Jan? Don't worry, I have got the tip.

quotes.speaker: Waiter
quotes.line: Wow, oh my God, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, that was a different hundred dollar bill.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I have generated a lot of interest in my party this evening.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: The party I'm having tonight in 308. Obviously, you are invited.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Michael, um... Jim and Josh are in meetings all day. And I am in and out of meetings. I can't stay on top of you 24/7.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: You should order the most expensive thing on the menu, so he knows you're worth it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: If you do that, you're going to have to put out.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, yeah. You'll have to put out.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Is there a key for Jane Doe? Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: Well, Jim and I have a meeting with Uni-ball in about forty-five minutes, so we should probably go now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, check this out. How about that? A little friendly competition. Stamford versus Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, Jim. Looks like you picked a bad time to defect, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Shut it. [answering phone] Hey, Pam, what's up? Yep, yech... no. Tell him I will give him general specifics tomorrow, okay? Yes. [to others] Say hi to Pam!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes. That is Josh and Dwight and Jim. [to others] Pam says hi. [into phone] Have fun on your date! Very good, talk to you later. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Not. It hit the rim. Okay, and... okay. Double or nothing.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: Or what?  We didn't bet anything, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Evan
quotes.line: Say, while I have you here, could I talk to you about some new and exciting advances to our product line?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jim and I have different definitions of friendship. I think it's talking and being friends, and Jim thinks it's moving to Connecticut and being best friends with Josh. Well, phooey on that. I, uh, I'm done. I am not going to be speaking with him anymore. Whatevs. Long-distance relationships never work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, let me tell you what we're looking for.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, Jan, really. With a rep from HammerMill.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Used to be. Evan will call you in the morning to work out the details. We can now sell HammerMill products.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, well, maybe next time you will estimate me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight's room key. And... Dwight's room. What can I say? Old habits die hard.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh my God. Dwight got a hooker! Oh my God, I gotta call... well, I gotta call somebody, I don't even know who to call. Dwight got a hooker!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: So, Alan, Pam is obsessed with your cartoons. She reads them every day.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: You love ketchup! He loves ketchup.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So how do you come up with your cartoons?

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.line: Well, I just, uh... I kinda think about stuff that I see, or dream them.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You dream in cartoons? How fun!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, first guest! You are going to have some tequila, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.line: I thought there was a party in here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Party central! So, what can I do you for? [Guy leaves] All right.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.line: See, this one is great, because it can work on a couple of different levels.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.line: [French accent] Freedom fries for the table.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.line: Yeah. I mean, people always say, like, "Don't be edgy." But I don't know any other way. Yeah, you get it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, it was, uh, it was really nice meeting you, Alan.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.line: Yeah. Next time bring some of your illustrations, I'll let you pick my brain.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I went on a date. It wasn't a love connection, um... I think when I like someone again, I'll just kinda know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Michael. Am I the first to arrive?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: People have been filtering in and out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sure, sounds good. So why are you here? Is Josh busy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I get it! No, no, I totally get it. He made a better paper airplane, Stamford is better in sales... I get it. We had some fun. We had some laughs. And that's just...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wait, wait. I didn't transfer because of you. You're a good boss. You're a great boss.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Michael, it's not about... I transferred because of Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh my God. You don't even know. She's single now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, I just... I heard something about that. It's just, I kind of put it all on the line. Twice, actually. And she said no. Twice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm sorry, man. I'm sorry. Hey, you know what? I will talk to her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I will. I'll talk to her. You should at least talk to Roy. I mean, he knows exactly how you're feeling.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey! No, you know, people have been filtering in and out.

quotes.speaker: Evan
quotes.line: Hey, uh... Arnie Reisman. Michael, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, we used to. Now we're friends.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Some people need dozens of friends to say, "Hey, look at me, I'm popular." But not me. I'm very picky. I need three, maybe two. When you meet that someone special, you'll just know. Because a real relationship, it... it can't be forced. It should just come about effortlessly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Now, would you do the pleasure of hitting the lights, sir? [lights go out, leaving Michael's black light on] Ha, ha, ha.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, God, I hope it's urine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Today I'm headed to Philadelphia for the annual Northeastern Office Supply Convention. [makes horns gesture and heavy metal scream] Wooo-yaaaaah! Oh, these things tend to be kind of crazy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Per-diem. [singing as he signs] Perrrr-diiiiieeeemmmm! [shows off $100 bill to Ryan] You know, Ryan, it's all about the Benjamins.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes. What? Oh, yeah, have Pam give those to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sure you don't want to come?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Gonna be fun! Change your mind we can get you a cot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: A couple of years ago, I went to one in Hartford. "Connecticut." And Todd Packer and I went to this bar and met a girl. And [laugh] Packer decides to make out with her. Turns out that her boyfriend is the bouncer at the bar. [laugh] I love this. The bouncer chases us out to Packer's Vette, jump in the Vette, he peels out, and I [laugh] I don't make it to the car. [turns serious] Um, and the other bouncers caught up with me and really did a number on me... It was in the paper... [brightens] But to answer your question, yeah, I'm really excited about this weekend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yup. Yeah, I applied for a job there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What would you have done? Been manager?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I was going to be a bottle capper.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You? A bottle capper?! [laughs in disbelief]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know, I know. Crazy world. Crazy, crazy world.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: Yes, I'm aware of Jan and Michael's... history. Um, I don't really like to talk about it 'cause it's unprofessional. Kind of gross.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Josh reminds me of a guy I went to high school with. Big football star, girls loved him. Whatever. Guess what he's doing now. He's a TV announcer for the Eagles. Up in the... [laughs] He doesn't even get to play in the game, I mean.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So, you ever been convicted of a felony?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: What? Uh, no. [to Jim] Uh, I want you to make sure you call Karen and get her to fax that vendor list over.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: Um... When I was in the Coast Guard, a couple of us broke into the women's barracks and we got arrested for trespassing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Coast Guard? So you know how to fight underwater?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [Jim, Josh, and Jan walk in the hotel lobby] Josh, um... [Jim continues walking ahead] Why don't you come up to my room for a couple of minutes and we can just go over the schedule for tomorrow together.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: Can we do it over breakfast? It'll be...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [putting on a good face] Great! [walks off]
